From: Robin Kirkman <robin@...>

OOC:
I'm rather embarrased, because, when I posted this, I was unaware that the 
player had injured themself. What a faupe! (Is that even close to the 
spelling?) Anyways, I'm sorry and quite sympathetic.

For now, I'll play the shuttle and what appears to be what Fractyl is doing. 
I hope this is okay, because I would like to get my character into the game, 
but don't want to overstep my boundaries.

::VorbIss::
VorbIss reached down and pulled up Fractyl, who grunted but remained silent. 
VorbIss himself, in complete turmoil from the mental contortions he had 
recently experienced, also refrained from speech, choosing to take a seat 
opposite Fractyl.

The shuttle took off, and headed south, toward the tip of Africa: The 
Alliance base.



On Saturday 01 September 2001 21:33, Robin Kirkman wrote:
> OOC:
> I'm back. I haven't seen any replies to this, though...
> --robin
>
> On Saturday 25 August 2001 15:53, Robin Kirkman wrote:
> > I, unfortunately, have no choice but to leave for a week (!). As such, I
> > authorize Yanshosh@... to play VorbIss where necessary, but as
> > minimally as possible.
> > --robin
> >
> > On Thursday 23 August 2001 23:44, Robin Kirkman wrote:
> > > ::VorbIss::
> > >
> > > VorbIss raised an eyebrow at Fractyl, but offered him an arm. "Need
> > > some help?"
> > >
> > > On Thursday 23 August 2001 22:48, Yanshosh@... wrote:
> > > > ::Fractyl::
> > > >
> > > > Fractyl shrugs, limping toward the shuttle. "Why in the pit not? I
> > > > can hold out there for a slagging while until I can contact my
> > > > faction."
> > > >
> > > > He reaches the shuttle and starts climbing up the hatch, having a bit
> > > > of trouble with it.
> >
